hypothesis_content.title: Fed QT End Liquidity Pump -> Crypto Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: Following the announced end of Fed QT and $13.5B liquidity injection, crypto markets will experience a 48-hour period of suppressed volatility (BTC 1D realized vol < 40%) before a directional breakout exceeding 2.5x the recent ATR, with the direction favoring the pre-news 4H trend.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Macro liquidity injections historically precede risk-asset rallies, but the initial reaction is often a 'digestion' period of low volatility as the market assesses the flow. The subsequent breakout tends to resolve in the direction of the underlying momentum, as new liquidity seeks the path of least resistance.
entry_conditions: Fed QT end/liquidity pump news confirmed timestamp
BTC 1D realized volatility (20-period) drops below 40% within 48h of news
BTC 4H price consolidates within +/-1.5% of news-release price for >12h
Pre-news 4H trend (50-period SMA slope) is established (Bullish/Bearish)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price moves >2.5x the 14-period ATR (calculated at entry) in the direction of the pre-news 4H trend.
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves >1.5x the 14-period ATR in the *opposite* direction of the pre-news 4H trend.

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Volatility fails to compress (<40%) post-news, or the breakout occurs opposite to the pre-news 4H trend more than 60% of the time in a sample of 10+ similar events.
